authors: Bianca La Cioppa For Daily Mail Australia
description: Sam Wood has revealed he is interested in signing up as a trainer for new series of The Biggest Loser Australia.
title: Sam Wood extending his TV career as a trainer on The Biggest Loser Australia
title_page: Sam Wood extending his TV career as a trainer on The Biggest Loser Australia | Daily Mail Online
text:
He rose to local fame last year after finding love on The Bachelor - and now Sam Wood has another reality television show in his sights.
The 35-year-old revealed to the latest issue of OK! Magazine that he is interested in signing up as a trainer for new series of The Biggest Loser Australia.
'I would love to be a trainer on The Biggest Loser,' he said to the publication.
Scroll down for video
New gig? Sam Wood has revealed he is interested in signing up as a trainer for new series of The Biggest Loser Australia
Sam, who has 15 years as a fitness coach, added: 'I think it's great what they do'.
It is not known when filming for the new series will begin and whether new-mum Michelle Bridges will be returning.
But while he has his goals set on the weight loss series, the personal trainer has kicked off his first 28 day fitness program.
Into it: The 35-year-old said: 'I would love to be a trainer on The Biggest Loser'
Coming soon? It is not known when filming for the new series will begin and whether new-mum Michelle Bridges will be returning
The four week diet includes morning smoothies, lower carb bread lunches, and hearty dinners.
'As a personal trainer, I see so many people wanting to lose a few kilos and tone up for summer,' he told the Daily Mail Australia last year.
'I want to encourage people to take simple steps to carbdown for summer. It doesn’t have to be difficult and with the Helga’s lower carb range, there’s no need to compromise on taste either.'
Fitness lover: But while he has his goals set on the weight loss series, the personal trainer has kicked off his first 28 day fitness program
Lining up: Since launching late last year the four week program has signed up I'm A Celebrity...Get me Out of Here! host Julia Morris (pictured) and radio host Kate Langbroek
Since launching comedian and TV personality Julia Morris and radio host Kate Langbroek have signed up to the challenged.
Sam's fiancée Snezana Markoski has also tried businessman's program and has so far lost five kilograms.
Daily Mail Australia has contacted Sam for comment.
